shopifyRole.description: Shopify provides the platform for dispute resolution but does not make decisions.

inquiry.description: A preliminary request for information from a cardholder's bank.
inquiry.financialImpact: No funds are withdrawn during the inquiry phase.

chargeback.description: A formal funds reversal initiated by the cardholder's bank.
chargeback.financialImpact: Disputed amount and a fee are immediately withdrawn.

steps.action: Agent receives evidence request via Shopify Admin.

outcomes.win: Disputed amount is returned. Fee may be refunded.
outcomes.partialWin: Part of the disputed amount is returned. Fee may be refunded.
outcomes.loss: Funds and fee are not returned. Decision is final.

steps.action: Bank sends inquiry request. No funds withdrawn.
Agent receives evidence request via Shopify Admin.
Agent submits evidence or resolves with customer.

outcomes.closedInFavor: Case is closed with no financial impact.
outcomes.escalatedToChargeback: Inquiry becomes a full chargeback. Funds and fee are now withdrawn.

fight.name: Fight the Dispute
fight.description: Submit evidence to prove the charge was valid.
evidenceFormattingRules: Ensure all submitted documents are clearly legible without zooming or cropping.
Do not use external links as evidence.

resolveWithCustomer.name: Resolve with Customer
resolveWithCustomer.description: Convince the customer to withdraw the dispute with their bank.
resolveWithCustomer.criticalWarning: Do NOT issue a refund until the chargeback is officially marked as won/canceled in the Shopify Admin. This can take 30-90 days.
withdrawalLetterRequirements: Must be on official bank letterhead.
Must display the chargeback case number.
Must confirm original charge date and amount.
Must confirm the chargeback has been canceled.
Must confirm funds were re-debited from the customer and returned to you.

accept.name: Accept the Dispute
accept.description: Concede the dispute when it is deemed valid.

procedures.onChargeback: Take no action. Do not submit evidence.
procedures.onInquiry: Issue a FULL refund for the order to prevent escalation. Submit proof of the full refund as evidence.

fraudulent.description: Cardholder claims they did not authorize the charge.
fraudulent.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to check if a family member made the purchase or if they've forgotten. If they agree the charge is valid, instruct them to call their bank to drop the chargeback.

unrecognized.description: Cardholder doesn't recognize the merchant name on their statement.
unrecognized.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to remind them of their purchase from your store. If they agree, instruct them to call their bank to drop the chargeback.

duplicate.description: Cardholder believes they were charged twice for the same item.
duplicate.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to explain the two charges were for separate items/services. If you made an error, accept the chargeback.

subscription_canceled.description: Cardholder was charged after they believed their subscription was canceled.
subscription_canceled.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to clarify the billing cycle versus their cancellation date. If you made an error, accept the chargeback.

product_not_received.description: Cardholder claims they never received the product/service.
product_not_received.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to check delivery status with them and investigate with the carrier. If resolved, instruct them to call their bank to drop the chargeback.

product_unacceptable.description: Product was defective, damaged, or not as described.
product_unacceptable.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to resolve the issue via your return/replacement policy. If they agree to drop the chargeback, obtain a withdrawal letter.

credit_not_processed.description: Cardholder returned an item but was not refunded.
credit_not_processed.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer to explain the status of their return/refund according to your policy. You cannot issue a refund while a chargeback is active.

general.description: A catch-all category for other dispute reasons.
general.recommendedCustomerAction: Contact customer immediately to understand the core issue. This is an information-gathering step.
